tensordb.tensor_definition.TensorDefinition¶

pydantic model tensordb.tensor_definition.TensorDefinition¶

The tensor definition is the core of tensordb, it allows adding functionalities to every tensor that are kept over the time, so you don’t have to know beforehand how to transform every tensor.

Show JSON schema

Fields

  • dag (Optional[tensordb.tensor_definition.DAGOrder])

  • definition (Optional[Dict[str, tensordb.tensor_definition.Definition]])

field dag: Optional[tensordb.tensor_definition.DAGOrder] [Required]¶

Indicate the relations/dependencies that a tensor has with others, useful for executing an operation over multiple tensors that has dependencies

field definition: Optional[Dict[str, tensordb.tensor_definition.Definition]] = {}¶

The key indicate to which method must be applied the definition (read the doc of Definition)

field metadata: Optional[Dict] = {}¶

Metadata of the tensor

field path: str [Required]¶

Path where the tensor is going to be stored (it’s concatenated to the base_map of tensor_client)

field storage: Optional[tensordb.tensor_definition.StorageDefinition] = StorageDefinition(storage_name='zarr_storage', synchronizer=None)¶

Useful to send parameters to the Storage constructor or to change the default data storage
